There is an [[amusement park]] near the town of Hellendoorn called ''Avonturenpark Hellendoorn''. == Population centres == The municipality comprises: Towns: * Hellendoorn * [[Nijverdal]] Hamlets: * {{Ill|nl|Daarle}} * [[Daarlerveen]] * {{Ill|nl|Eelen en Rhaan|Eelen}} * [[Egede, Netherlands|Egede]] * {{Ill|nl|Haarle|Haarle (Hellendoorn)}} * {{Ill|nl|Hancate}} * [[Hulsen]] * {{Ill|nl|Marle, Overijssel|Marle (Hellendoorn)}} * {{Ill|nl|Noetsele}} (former hamlet, now an integrated part of Nijverdal) == Geography == [[File:Noetselerberg(1).jpg|thumb|left|{{Ill|nl|Noetselerberg}}]] The central part of the municipality consists of a hilly and sparsely populated area that extends south into the municipality of [[Rijssen-Holten]], called the [[Sallandse Heuvelrug]] (Salland Ridge). The highest point lies at about {{Convert|70|m}} above [[sea level]] and is part of the {{Ill|nl|Noetselerberg}}. A large chunk of the area is covered by [[forest]], but there are also [[heath (habitat)|heathlands]]. This scenery is now part of the [[Sallandse Heuvelrug National Park]]. Originally part of the region of [[Salland]], Hellendoorn is now administratively considered part of [[Twente]]; a fact reflected in the inclusion of Hellendoorn in the [[city region]] of Twente (''Kaderwetgebied Regio Twente'') as defined by the [[Cabinet of the Netherlands|Dutch government]]. == History == The municipality of Hellendoorn is the only place in the Netherlands where gold mining took place. The Germans operated a [[V-2 rocket|V-2]] launching platform near the town of Hellendoorn during World War II, harassing the city of London. On March, 22nd 1945, Nijverdal was severely bombed by allied bombers who were going after the German Reichskommissar of Austrian origine [[Arthur Seyss-Inquart]]. Seyss-Inquart was fleeing the advancing Allied forces and had set up his temporary headquarters in the Reformed School in Nijverdal, but had already left town at the time of the bombing. Over 70 people were killed, mainly at de Grotestraat. A small part of the film ''[[A Bridge Too Far (1977 film)|A Bridge Too Far]]'' was filmed near Hellendoorn. In 1955, part of the municipality of Wierden was annexed (Eversberg, Konijnenbelt, Slettenhaar and Lochter) which is the only part of the municipality located on originally Twente soil. In the late 70's the quarter of 'het Lochter' arose here. == Born in Hellendoorn == *[[Herman Ponsteen]] (born 1953), Dutch track cyclist who won silver at the [[1976 Summer Olympics]] ==Gallery== <gallery> File:Rollercoaster Tornado Avonturenpark Hellendoorn Netherlands.jpg|Rollercoaster Tornado </gallery> ==External links== {{commonscat}} *{{Official|http://www.hellendoorn.nl }} {{Geographic location | Centre = Hellendoorn | North = [[Ommen]] | Northeast = [[Twenterand]] | East = [[Wierden]] | South = [[Rijssen-Holten]] | West = [[Raalte]] }} {{Overijssel Province}} [[Category:Municipalities of Overijssel]] [[Category:Populated places in Overijssel]] [[Category:Salland]] [[Category:Twente]] {{Overijssel-geo-stub}}
